list_definition.definition: to separate into parts or groups

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The wall divided the garden in two
The group divided into three when we got off the bus
We are divided (= We do not agree) as to where to spend our holidays.
We divided the sweets between us.

list_definition.definition: to find out how many times one number contains another

list_ex_of_english: I suggest dividing my study of analytical representation into four steps.
The nationalist camp, divided into two and then three rival groups, was feeble and spent much of the time in internecine conflict.
As mentioned above, voters can be divided into personal and party voters or, equivalently for our purposes, sincere and strategic voters.
Comments may conveniently be divided into those which are in sentence form, and those which are not.
The poem proper is divided into fifteen sections with an envoy.
The material here is divided into two sections.
Chapter 4 on cognitive deficits is divided into two sections.
The book is divided into four par ts on the basis of quite broad subject areas; each section contains six reprinted ar ticles.
